JobFullDesc: Senior Program Manager – Finance Data and Experiences team Do you want to help us revolutionize how Microsoft measures, monitors, and manages its $140B business portfolio? Do you want to help us design and build the next generation of cutting-edge user experiences & analytics platforms using the latest technology stack?  Do you want to influence our product engineering teams in building the next generation of services and capabilities used by millions of users worldwide? If so, we may have a great opportunity for you in the Finance Data & Experiences (or FD&E for short) global organization. In FD&E, we build solutions at scale that enable our company to run its end-to-end business more effectively and more efficiently. We operate within the business and have strong delivery partnerships across Finance, Sales, Marketing, and Engineering. Our products influence data-driven decision making across a vast array of users and audiences, ranging from the company’s Senior Leadership Team to front-line sellers working with our customers. We pride ourselves with a culture of customer centricity, innovation, agility, transparency, and flexibility. We are always eager to hear new ideas and promote out of the box thinking when addressing complex process, architecture, or technology challenges.ResponsibilitiesThe role’s core responsibilities include:Manage a team of Program Managers who work closely with the business partners to help deliver data and reporting which is used in measuring business performance and make critical business decisions.Ownership of all PM related activities including project/sprint management, communications, requirement gathering, support orchestration, executive status updates, business partner relationship management and drive evangelization and education efforts for our owned solutions/tools.Drive high impact cross team strategic projects as needed to meet the changing business environment and ensure the team is achieving commitments.Lead design framework and help architect Data solutions to support Microsoft’s business, resulting in actionable roadmaps thru deep understanding of key business scenarios to define clear requirements.Develop and implement optimized processes & instrumentation to enable best-in-class customer service.Effective partnerships with other BI PM, engineering, data science, and corporate system organization leads to jointly define execution strategies across the different programs’ priorities.Collaborate and be a thought leader on data quality assurance processes to ensure high data quality and credibility.Strategic thinking and planning to address and support business needs using advanced BI capabilities/tools.Help user base maximize the value of our Data solutions through readiness, training and hand-on support.QualificationsThe ideal candidate will have the following qualifications:BA/BS in Computer Science, Mathematics, MBA or other technical/quantitative discipline.7+ years of experience managing technical programs; Strong DevOps experience preferred.People management experience is preferred.Previous development experience in Business Intelligence or Object-Oriented Programming a strong plus.Familiarity with Microsoft BI stack preferred, Azure experience highly valued.Passion for using data and analytics to drive business value.Problem solving mindset that craves complex challenges and business problems under a fast paced/changing environment.A structural, repeatable approach in solving complex problems, can communicate to senior decision makers in a clear, compelling way, and drive decisive action in partnership with others in a large organization.Stellar cross group collaboration, able to drive decisive action in partnership with others in a large organization and deliver results that depend on other divisions and external partners.Ability to work independently in highly ambiguous environments, with both technical and business groups internally and externally.Experience managing agile development environments with Scrum highly preferred. Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
